formattedAddress: 350 Lenox Ave, New York, NY 10027, USA
adrFormatAddress: 350 Lenox Ave, New York, NY 10027, USA

editorialSummary.text: Chic Japanese sushi bar serving premium rolls, rice bowls & noodle dishes, plus sake, wine & beer.

originalText.text:
The food is really good here.

Prices are quite reasonable for New York, and the quality is great. For appetizers, I highly recommend their agedashi tofu. This lightly fried tofu is topped with scallions and served in a dashi broth. It was so good we ended up ordering a second one!

For rolls, they have so many delicious choices. We got their California roll, the pickled radish roll, the fried sweet potato roll, and their salmon roll. Each was excellent in their own unique way.

I also have to comment on the radish they serve on the side. I really like how fresh this radishes as it is not too strong of a flavor for those who are not used to it. It is a little lighter and sweeter.

If you don’t like, fishy smell, sit outside and eat, as the inside of the restaurant is a heavy fish smell. Service is a little slow as they have very few staff serving many people, but they do a good job.

originalText.text:
This restaurant opened years ago, and we've always walked by, I wanted to try it, but the prices were not in our budget.  Today, my husband picked me up from the train station at 125th and Lenox. We were hungry, and as we walked by Yuzu, we decided to walk in.

Everything was so cozy and serene, I had the Bento box with perfect kaarage and edamame, Hubby had wagyu beef and sake

originalText.text: First time in this restaurant and I loved it. Food was delicious and super fresh. Highly recommend.

text.text: First time in this restaurant and I loved it. Food was delicious and super fresh. Highly recommend.

originalText.text: Well for starters the sushi was great. I had the sushi platter with a California roll and a cold saki. I ate inside, and the service was excellent . Social distancing was practiced as well as mask wearing. I was impressed when some jerk came in without a mask twice and the two ladies told him we'll call the police and he left. I'll be back again. Quality sushi!!!!! To be totally honest, I would recommend this sushi bar as the best in NYC!!!! Fresh, tasty and prepared proper. You won't be disappointed!!!!

text.text: Well for starters the sushi was great. I had the sushi platter with a California roll and a cold saki. I ate inside, and the service was excellent . Social distancing was practiced as well as mask wearing. I was impressed when some jerk came in without a mask twice and the two ladies told him we'll call the police and he left. I'll be back again. Quality sushi!!!!! To be totally honest, I would recommend this sushi bar as the best in NYC!!!! Fresh, tasty and prepared proper. You won't be disappointed!!!!

originalText.text:
Food and service is top quality here. Laid back environment with an assortment of sushi dishes from basic California rolls to spicy salmon and tuna rolls. Also, don't forget to ask for the fish of the day.

In addition to their sushi bowls they also offer small bento boxes.

Their mango crepe is also a gem.
